net.wombatrpgs.rainfall.maps
Class Level

java.lang.Object
  net.wombatrpgs.rainfall.maps.Level
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable
public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderable

A Level is comprised of a .tmx tiled map background and a bunch of events that populate it. I can hear you already, "IT'S CALLED A MAP." No need to conflict with the data structure. Anyway this thing is a wrapper around Tiled with a few RPG-specific functions built in, like rendering its layers in order so that the player's sprite can appear say above the ground but below a cloud or other upper chip object.

queueRequiredAssets

public void queueRequiredAssets(com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager manager)
Queues up all the assets required to render this level in the resource manager. Does not actually load them. The level should be initialized first, but this should happen in the constructor.

Specified by:
queueRequiredAssets in interface Renderable

applyPhysicalCorrections

public void applyPhysicalCorrections(MapEvent event)
Adjusts an event on the level based on its collisions. This usually involves moving it out of said collisions.

Parameters:
event -

teleportOff

public void teleportOff()
Teleports the hero off of this map and makes preparations for hero control no longer on the map.

teleportOff

public void teleportOff(MapObject toRemove)
Removes a map object from this map. The object is assumed not to be the hero. Control remains on this map.

Parameters:
toRemove - The map object to remove

teleportOn

public void teleportOn(int tileX,
                       int tileY)
Welcome a new arrival to this map! The hero! This is specifically made to transfer control to this level and plop the hero event down at (x,y)

Parameters:
x - The x-coord to teleport to (in tiles)
y - The y-coord to teleport to (in tiles)

teleportOn

public void teleportOn(MapObject newObject,
                       int tileX,
                       int tileY)
Welcomes a new event to this map. Does not transfer level control. Event is assumed to not be the hero.

Parameters:
newObject - The object to teleport in
tileX - The initial x-coord (in tiles) of this object
tileY - The initial y-coord (in tiles) of this object
